definition: to cover up/to conceal/to mask/to gloss over
decoration/ornament/to decorate/to adorn/to hide/to conceal (a fault)/excuse (to hide a fault)/to play a role (in opera)/to impersonate

sentences.english: He disguised these feelings under an enormous bellowing and hurraying.
sentences.chinese: 他用大聲吼叫和喝采掩飾着這些感情。

sentences.english: The cracks and flaws in Mary's old performance have been skillfully varnished over.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗以往表演中的一些缺點都被巧妙地掩飾過去了。

sentences.english: But how could we disguise the fact that I was not [even] fifteen years old?
sentences.chinese: 可我們怎麼才能掩飾我還不到15足歲的事實呢？

sentences.english: It means we need not dissemble.
sentences.chinese: 這意味着我們不需要任何掩飾。

sentences.english: The right style of swimsuit can help by hiding bulges .
sentences.chinese: 款式適當的游泳衣有助於掩飾肥胖部位。

sentences.english: Without some dissimulation no business can be carried on at all.
sentences.chinese: 假如沒有掩飾，沒有任何商業活動可以進行。

sentences.english: Do not meet does not mean not miss, do not contact just to cover up nostalgic.
sentences.chinese: 䇓翱不見面不等於不思念，不聯絡只是爲了掩飾眷戀。
他的笑容掩飾他的憤怒情緒。

sentences.english: To conceal this moment with a radian already a wrinkled face sad.
sentences.chinese: 一抹弧度來掩飾此刻已皺起的一臉難過。

sentences.english: To talk about a water crisis hides intractable problems such as poverty.
sentences.chinese: 談論水危機掩飾了諸如貧窮這樣棘手的問題。

sentences.english: She felt the deepest respect for his skill at dissemBling .
sentences.chinese: 她對他的掩飾技巧深感佩服。

sentences.english: “Never lie” also can be extended as “Don’t mask truths.
sentences.chinese: “不要說謊”也可以引申爲“不掩飾真相”。

sentences.english: The disaccord in my words is hardly to cover the endorse in my heart.
sentences.chinese: 嘴上的不以爲然，只是在掩飾我內心的完全贊同。

sentences.english: People are always in skillfully varnished himself.
sentences.chinese: 人總是在巧妙地掩飾自己。

sentences.english: I muttered to hide the catch in my voice.
sentences.chinese: 我咕噥着，想掩飾我說話時的哽塞。

definition: to conceal/to hide behind/to cover up
to conceal/to hide (a taboo subject)/to cover up the truth
to admit/to concede/to recognize/recognition (diplomatic, artistic etc)/to acknowledge
to pretend to be (asleep etc)/to disguise oneself as/pretense/disguise/(military) to camouflage/camouflage
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though
in the end/after all is said and done
a modal particle indicating (don't mind it, ok)
a modal particle indicating (that's all, only, nothing much)
